QxtLoggerEngine Class Reference
[QxtCore module]

The parent class of all extended Engine Plugins. More...

Detailed Description

Overview

QxtLoggerEngine is what gives the QxtLogger it's power. While the Logger itself manages memory, logic, and log levels, it is the various Engine Plugins that do the actual work of logging the data.

Member Documentation

QxtLoggerEngine ( )

Constructor




virtual ~QxtLoggerEngine ( )

Destructor




virtual void initLoggerEngine ( ) =0

Initializes the logger engine.

This function is called by QxtLogger. Reimplement this function when creating a subclass of QxtLoggerEngine.




virtual void killLoggerEngine ( ) =0

Kills the logger engine.

This function is called by QxtLogger. Reimplement this function when creating a subclass of QxtLoggerEngine.




virtual bool isInitialized ( ) const =0

Returns true if the logger engine is initialized.

This function is called by QxtLogger. Reimplement this function when creating a subclass of QxtLoggerEngine.




virtual void writeFormatted ( QxtLogger::LogLevel level , const QList< QVariant > & messages ) =0

Writes a formatted message.

This function is called by QxtLogger. Reimplement this function when creating a subclass of QxtLoggerEngine.




virtual void setLoggingEnabled ( bool enable = true )

Sets logging enabled or disabled.




bool isLoggingEnabled ( ) const

Returns true if logging is enabled and false otherwise.




void enableLogging ( )

Enables logging.




void disableLogging ( )

Disables logging.




virtual void setLogLevelsEnabled ( QxtLogger::LogLevels levels , bool enable = true )

Sets log levels enabled or disables.




bool isLogLevelEnabled ( QxtLogger::LogLevel level ) const

Returns true if log level is enabled and false otherwise.




void enableLogLevels ( QxtLogger::LogLevels levels )

Enables log levels.




void disableLogLevels ( QxtLogger::LogLevels levels )

Disables log levels.
